comment: Nice light copper color with a rich complex nose. The flavor isn’t as intense as the nose and color might suggest, but still nice. Basically a darker, richer and zestier version of a normal Highlands scotch. Mouthfeel is a notch or two below “creamy”, but definitely not “thin”. Fun to try, but maybe not worth the price? 3.77.
Ruikt heerlijk, maar smaak is heel vlak, vluchtig en beetje medicinaal
pretty decent. middle of the road

Light bodied, fruity, smooth, and clean. Got light fig and date flavor to it. Royal Lochnagar’s juice can be found in the higher end Johnnie walkers, so drinking this would definitely remind you some of the characters of JWs. Overall a pleasant daily dram.
Butterscotch heavy with bright fruit. Mildly creamy, especially on the nose.
black licorice. nutmeg, with vanilla BEAN notes
Citrus and vanilla nose with a spicy butterscotch taste.

★★★½
La déception de la soirée.
J'avais énormément d'attente pour ce whisky emblématique de la maison qui a renversé le "mad king". Je m'attendais à quelque chose de puissant, de coriace, de violent. Je commence sérieusement à penser que tout ceci est vraiment un gros coup de pub pour des whiskys ordinaires...
Light and smooth, and apparently, I would be a Baratheon

App: Amber
Nose: Caramel, Vanilla, 🍌
Palate: little Smokey, oily, nice easy taste. 
Finish: Short

Nose:  light, sweet, caramel, floral
Palate: thick mouthfeel, mild spice, rich, toffee
Finish: short to medium length, rich, mildly spicy 
Not very complex but still very enjoyable and drinkable.
Nose starts dry before a burst of sweet and citrus.  Citrus is surprisingly absent in the flavor, which is earthier, warming.
Hints of fruit and very smooth
Strawberry on the nose.  Taste mostly grass

Nose- green apple jolly ranchers, oak, lemon zest, oranges

Palate- oak, pineapple, lemon, smoky undertones

Finish- Short, fruity finish with just a hint of smoke

This is unique, there’s not denying that. But with that being said, it’s very one dimensional. All I get on the nose, palate and finish are tropical fruits and oak. Usually I love this combo accompanied by other smells and flavors, but when it’s just the two, it doesn’t quite work for me. Still an alright drinker, but very simple and forgettable.

Nose: simple with smells of orange and some vanilla. 
Palate: smooth with a little spice, medium flavors, easy to drink. Smokey finish.

Malty, grassy, floral nose.

This is a fairly light whiskey- it's very grassy and floral.  I get strong rose petals/floral, honey, lemon, with a bitter herb/grass aftertaste, but the floral and honey notes persist into the finish.

The floral/honey elements are kinda surprising, as they are quite pronounced, and a bit unusual.

This isn't particularly complex, but it's pleasantly drinkable.

Nose - pear, clove, honey, toast

Taste - vanilla custard, clove/allspice, maple

Not bad, pretty tasty after dinner whisky. Doesn’t live up the Talisker or Oban bottlings in the GOT line, but is up there.
Gently smoky. Hints of raisin, vanilla, and peppercorn
